definition: one's purpose in coming
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: When they heard what he had come for, they were greatly pleased, and promised him money;
sentences.chinese: 聽到他的來意後，他們非常高興，答應給他賞錢。

sentences.english: He leaned on the desk and declared his intentions to the clerk.
sentences.chinese: 他靠着桌子向店員說明了來意。

sentences.english: I have heard some malevolent misrepresentation of her.
sentences.chinese: 我聽到一些來意曲解她的話。

sentences.english: To coal companies who export to the Tang Wang Shunli explained what the guard.
sentences.chinese: 來者向唐口煤業公司門衛王順利說明來意。

sentences.english: I have come quite simply, to ask you a great favour.
sentences.chinese: 我的來意很簡單，先生，是來請您幫忙的。

sentences.english: Reporter thereupon marks a standing and explains purpose, the of"Wang Da Dun Xian" is embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 記者隨即表明身份，說明來意，“王大仙”頓顯尷尬。

sentences.english: The woman set down her bag and set forth her purpose in coming.
sentences.chinese: 這名婦女放下她的包後闡明瞭她的來意。

sentences.english: You face underhand manoeuvres often, enough you sense when somebody isn't being entirely forthright about their intentions.
sentences.chinese: 面對來意不明的對手的時候你總是趨於防守止步不前。

sentences.english: When we mentioned what we had come for, they immediately offered to help us.
sentences.chinese: 當我們談明來意之後，他們立即提出要幫我們的忙。

definition: to reply
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
reluctant to part
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
subject (under discussion)/thread (of an argument)
to tease/to poke fun at
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
calm and composed (idiom)
to inquire into/to ask after
careless/heedless/absent-minded/indifferent
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to sing
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
to worry/to be on one's mind
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
